name: places/ChIJRQxJyBf2wokRcL4OgMpygPU
formattedAddress: 300 Manhattan Ave, New York, NY 10026, USA
adrFormatAddress: 300 Manhattan Ave, New York, NY 10026, USA

originalText.text:
I cannot say enough positive things about Bilingual Nest. From the moment we walked in for a tour, I knew that this was the perfect place for our son. Our son's teachers: Juley & Christina, and the staff are exceptional - warm, friendly, and incredibly professional. They truly care about each child's well-being and go above and beyond to ensure that every child feels happy, safe, and loved.

The facility itself is always clean, well-maintained, and filled with age-appropriate toys and activities that foster learning and growth, such soccer classes, nature walks, Halloween Parade, Christmas Event, among others. Their bilingual program is amazing and proper to their early dual language development.

I also appreciate the communication and transparency provided by the staff. The app they use to keep us  informed of our son's progress and activities, and are always available to answer any questions or concerns we may have.

With mixed feelings we had to moved to a different neighborhood, but during our son's time at Bilingual Nest, I had complete peace of mind when I drop him off, knowing that he was in great hands. I highly recommend this daycare to any parent looking for a safe, nurturing, and stimulating environment for their child.

originalText.text: BN is truly an exceptional school. My son was able to learn in both French and Spanish. Aside from the language skills, the school has a set curriculum that they use. My son came home everyday with something new he learned. I’m so grateful for the platform, the foundation that this school has helped build and instill in our son. The teachers and staff are truly exceptional (kind, knowledgeable, professional and caring) I Would recommend this school 1000 times over!

originalText.text: Our youngest daughter went to the Bilingual Nest. She was in a French toddler class. She loved going to her daycare. She would sing on her way there. Her teachers, Jessica and Nicole, were both so kind and loving. The most important thing for any parent is that their child is safe and loved. On top of that, children always did art, learned words in both languages, they went out every day,  they had soccer every Thursday… and much more. I would recommend Bilingual Nest to any parent out there!

originalText.text: I honesty wish Bilingual Nest assist families that are not able to afford for there children to attend . Unfortunately this establishment doesn’t take vouchers at all . Just sad because I heard great things about Bilingual Nest.

originalText.text: We placed our daughter in Bilingual Nest when she was 15 months old for the entire school year. We were extremely pleased with the smooth transition she made to daycare thanks to the very dedicated and caring staff. Our daughter was happy to go there and see her teachers everyday. The staff is very communicative and we love that they also keep us informed during the day by keeping a log of our child's activities and by sending pictures. We completely trust the Bilingual Next staff with our daughter's care and would highly recommend their school.
